07fd3ce2-8710-4bb1-a8d7-64690bd5b1d1.description: Learn to Lead with UNSW is a specially curated short course for UNSW alumni on the topic of leadership. Facilitated by UNSW academics and alumni, Learn to Lead draws upon research and knowledge from across the University and community more broadly. Presented in modules, covering four distinct yet interconnected areas of leadership, this short course is relevant for any leader, no matter career stage, role or experience.

32fc4622-7caf-4ca1-a7e2-9f1531621b5c.description: The Cooper HIV/AIDS Research Training (CHART) Program is an education and training initiative that aims to expand the number of skilled and experienced HIV researchers in the Asia-Pacific region, at the same time as addressing local HIV priorities. The CHART Program operates over 12 months through a ‘learning by doing’ model that includes three intensive skill-based workshops, with individual research projects conducted in participants home countries.
32fc4622-7caf-4ca1-a7e2-9f1531621b5c.name: CHART Program

alignments.name: Peer Review
alignments.description: Participants are provided with hands-on mentoring by Kirby Institute Academics during the workshops, and when undertaking research projects in their country.

alignments.name: HIV Policy and Practice
alignments.description: Participants acquire the knowledge and skills that prepare them to undertake research focused on key areas of need. At the same time, they generate new local knowledge that informs regional HIV policy and practice.

alignments.name: Structured Operational Research Training Initiative (SORT IT)
alignments.description: The CHART Program is supported by an unconditional education grant from ViiV Healthcare. The Kirby Institute is a global partner of the Structured Operational Research Training Initiative (SORT IT), coordinated by TDR, the Special Programme for Research and Training in Tropical Diseases, hosted at the World Health Organization.

badge_template_activities.title: Attend three intensive skill-based workshops, each of 5-6 days duration. The workshops take place at the Kirby Institute at UNSW Sydney, over a 12-month period.
Develop and finalise a research protocol and ethics submission
Submit protocol and ethical review form(s) for approval
Provide instrument for electronic data entry and submit of the data documentation sheets
Conduct individual research projects in home country
Draft a manuscript , pending the findings and success of the research. Participants are strongly encouraged to submit their draft manuscript to a peer-reviewed journal for publication.
Use research findings as evidence for policy, to inform clinical guidelines or facilitate change

34f2af0b-b99e-4326-b895-c7516322e0fa.description: Applications are reviewed by a selection panel, comprised of representatives from AGSM @ UNSW Business School and the Department of Defence. 49ad4ece-c7db-48d7-9323-b3d7071f863f.name: Department of Finance Financial Analysis II

78b36d9b-9654-4513-bfb4-01be5413863a.description: Individuals awarded this badge have demonstrated the capacity to appreciate the importance of negotiation and networking skills to achieve business results. Understand persuasion, negotiation strategy and methods to plan and structure negotiations and deal with negotiation biases. Examine potential negotiation challenges and identify methods to overcome them. Explore how negotiation and networking can achieve personal and business success in all sectors and role types.
78b36d9b-9654-4513-bfb4-01be5413863a.name: Pride Symposium: Networking & Negotiation

badge_template_activities.title: Attend Pride@AGSM Leadership Symposium: Networking and Negotiation

To identify the root cause of the problem and work as a team to assess viable options, whilst managing and mitigating any risks, enabling more confident, highly skilled decision-makers.
c4212867-ca2c-43bb-aa6a-81ebd8788ef8.name: Product Management Capability Program

badge_template_activities.title: Complete all program requirements including 3 workshop days and an action learning challenge project.

ac2791c0-c034-48e4-b032-47d0961b967d.description: Individuals who complete this course, can evaluate appropriate approaches, methods and tools to use for different types of project, based on the project’s level of uncertainty, risk and complexity. The participants are able to define the role of project governance and sponsorship in engaging and aligning project stakeholders to the project objectives. They can explore the trade-off between time, cost and scope to optimise performance and team productivity.
ac2791c0-c034-48e4-b032-47d0961b967d.name: Project Management for Executives

33c7a34e-212b-421e-b362-36677f5a23e6.description: Individuals who complete this course, have a deeper understanding of the concepts of purpose, purpose-driven leadership and common reasons for ethical failures. They can use practical tools to engage in ethical thinking, decision-making and leadership. They can apply specific actions to accelerate their growth as ethical leaders who engage in purpose-driven leadership. They are able to develop, or revisit, their purpose, values and principles at the individual, team and organisational levels.
33c7a34e-212b-421e-b362-36677f5a23e6.name: Purpose and Ethics

They have the ability to apply change frameworks to organisational and strategic challenges. They are able to evaluate resources, systems and structures that impact successful strategy execution. They are able to develop, or revisit, their purpose, values and principles at the individual, team and organisational levels.

85e72100-d2e8-4c61-a22c-47fd9d870694.description: Individuals who complete AGSM’s Self-Managed Super Fund Program will have demonstrated the building of key SMSF related skills and their reputation in the growing areas of SMSF. Designed for the current economic climate and beyond, it covers essential topics such as operating standards (contributions and benefits), investment standards, taxation contributions, entity taxation and taxation of benefit payments.
85e72100-d2e8-4c61-a22c-47fd9d870694.name: Self-Managed Super-Fund

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this digital badge individuals will have Participated in 5 virtual workshops on operating standards (contributions and benefits), investment standards, taxation contributions, entity taxation and taxation of benefit payments. Attend 5 weekly online discussions. Complete a weekly questionnaire to ensure ongoing understanding of the learning. Demonstrate evidence of how concepts from each module are applied in an organisational context.

3afba2f7-346b-4129-985e-f657e2ce18b5.description: Over the course of 5 modules, and a 6-month embedding period the course instils an evolving and growth mindset to enable participants to realise shared transformative and systemic change and address the leadership gaps identified in the PMES. The program prepares senior managers with the capabilities and perspectives to lead the organisation and transition towards RHIP’s dynamic environment – now and in the future.
3afba2f7-346b-4129-985e-f657e2ce18b5.name: SESLHD and SCHN Leading with Impact

badge_template_activities.title: Participants will have completed 5 modules each including a blend of webinars and face-to-face sessions, with a number of extra activities and resources including a 6 month embedding period to help embed their learning.

d8459788-3b5a-45d8-938d-e381a33bf1d6.description: Over the course of 5 modules, and a 6-month embedding period the course instils an evolving and growth mindset to enable participants to realise shared transformative and systemic change and address the leadership gaps identified in the PMES. f85c2a84-faa7-4eeb-b18b-10923e895c97.description: This course provides the participant with the skills and practices critical to being a successful, resilient and adaptive leader. Upon completion of this course you will be able to articulate the nature of a technical vs an adaptive challenge, diagnose a context as chaotic, simple, complicated or complex as well as use political nous to map, navigate and influence relevant and important systems and apply the process of addressing immunity to change for a personal and organisational challenge.
f85c2a84-faa7-4eeb-b18b-10923e895c97.name: Strategic and Adaptive Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge the participant will attend 4x 2- hour virtual workshops and a half day in person workshop as well as complete self paced pre and post activities before attending the workshops. They will have also attended a post course group coaching session.

afc61b26-c10c-473e-b5f2-97ce89d90936.description: On completion participants will understand the scope and importance of Tax Administration including such key issues as: rule of law, sources of administrative powers and accountability of the administrator. Key concepts include: access; notices to produce; proper purpose; legal privilege; rulings; assessments; amendments; remedial power; objections & appeals; ADR; fraud/evasion; penalties, collection; taxpayer privacy; freedom of information; Inspector-General of Taxation.
afc61b26-c10c-473e-b5f2-97ce89d90936.name: Tax Administrative Law

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of 2 online workshops totalling a duration of 10 hours, active participation at the online workshops.
Successful completion of an online assessment.

658f7a34-79ca-4bbe-8a6b-ee5fe3d98ab9.description: Individuals are able to explain the reason for taxing capital gains, identify basic capital gains tax (CGT) events and determine when one has occurred. They can identify assets that the CGT provisions apply to, calculate a capital gain or capital loss and a net capital gain or net capital loss. They can identify the basic exemptions for capital gains and capital losses, describe the operation of the CGT rollover provisions and outline the CGT record-keeping requirements for taxpayers.
658f7a34-79ca-4bbe-8a6b-ee5fe3d98ab9.name: Taxation of Capital Gains

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of 2 online workshops totalling a duration of 10 hours, active participation at the online workshops.
Successful completion of an online assessment.

skills.name: Statutory Extension Of The Income Tax Base

e3003528-1a7b-4f41-931d-ebcb0dff17f3.description: Upon completion of this program, individuals will understand the key elements of the superannuation system and describe the principal taxing provisions. Participants will develop the required skills to identify the fundamental concepts and building blocks of the superannuation system, explain the rules in relation to the taxation and regulation of superannuation funds, and calculate the income tax implications of superannuation contributions, net income, and benefit payments.
e3003528-1a7b-4f41-931d-ebcb0dff17f3.name: Taxation of Superannuation

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of 2 online workshops totalling a duration of 10 hours, active participation at the online workshops.
Successful completion of an online assessment.

skills.name: Taxation of superannuation fund net income

cb940650-5d1a-4b7c-aef0-72c999355db1.description: Upon completion of this program, individuals will understand the elements of a trust, identify the trust concept in equity, recognise how a trust can be created, and describe the principal taxing provisions. The participants have developed required skills to identify the amounts to be included in the ‘net income’ of a trust estate, calculate the ‘income of a trust estate’, calculate a beneficiary’s share of net income, and calculate the income tax implications for a beneficiary and/or trustee.
cb940650-5d1a-4b7c-aef0-72c999355db1.name: Tax of Trusts

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of 2 online workshops totalling a duration of 10 hours, active participation at the online workshops
Successful completion of the assessment components.

fc6c9f99-e4e0-4d20-bf2e-883b275688f8.description: Upon completion of this program, individuals will understand the criteria for creating a good tax system. They will have considered the key components of the Australian tax system, including the personal income tax, the corporate income tax and Australia's international tax settings, from a design perspective and considered alternative designs. Individuals will also understand the practical considerations that arise when designing a tax system.
fc6c9f99-e4e0-4d20-bf2e-883b275688f8.name: Tax Policy

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of 2 online workshops totalling a duration of 10 hours, active participation at the online workshops.
